creator: christian.matuszewski@gmx.de
text:
Ant will hang with the following snippet (after starting the server):




<target name="test2">


    <parallel>


        <antcall target="start_server">


        ...


        </antcall>


        <sequential>


            <junit fork="yes" dir="${basedir}" printsummary="bla">


            ....


            </junit>


            <antcall target="stop_server"/>


        </sequential>


    </parallel>


</target>




Expected is an error message like: "bla is not a legal value for this attribute"


(I'm using jdk 1.3.1)

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
Hmm,

does your "start_server" ever finish?  I.e. will your antcall return if you never
call "stop_server" in stand-alone invocations?

creator: christian.matuszewski@gmx.de
text:
No, "stop_server" isn't finished by itself. It needs the call of the
"stop_server"  target to finish.

Well, there's the problem.

Your defunct <junit> makes the build fail in one thread and Ant waits for the
other thread to finish - which never happens.  There isn't much Ant can
currently do.
creator: bodewig@apache.org
conor@apache.org
text:
<parallel> now supports an optional failonany attribute. If any nested tasks
fail, <parallel> will complete without waiting for the other threads to
complete. In your case you would then see the junit exception.
